Title: A Quiet Place: Day One
Based on: Characters by  Bryan Woods Scott Beck
Produced by:
Michael Bay 
 Andrew Form 
 Brad Fuller 
 John Krasinski
Starring:
Lupita Nyong'o 
 Joseph Quinn 
 Alex Wolff 
 Djimon Hounsou
Production: In November 2020, Paramount Pictures announced a spin-off film set within the same world as A Quiet Place (2018), with Jeff Nichols set to write and direct, based on an original story by John Krasinski. Krasinski will also serve as producer alongside Michael Bay, Andrew Form, and Brad Fuller. The film is a co-production between Paramount Pictures, Sunday Night Productions, and Platinum Dunes. In May 2021, Krasinski announced that the script was complete and submitted to the studio. By October of the same year however, Nichols dropped out of the film due to creative differences while the studio was reported to be quickly looking for a replacement. In January 2022, Michael Sarnoski was announced to replace Nichols as writer and director.

The casting of Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn was reported in November 2022. Alex Wolff was cast in January 2023. In March, it was announced that Djimon Hounsou was reprising his role from A Quiet Place Part II (2020) as the "Man on the Island", now revealed to be named "Henri".
Principal photography began on February 6, 2023 in London, and wrapped on April 11.
Release: A Quiet Place: Day One is scheduled to be released in the United States by Paramount Pictures on June 28, 2024. It was previously scheduled to be released on March 31, 2023, then on September 22, 2023, and on March 8, 2024.
